page.title: 18Local Artist's View
page.content: The area around Christchurch and Mudeford is unique.Two rivers,the Avon and the Stour find their way out to the sea through Christchurch Harbour. Viewed from Hengistbury Head,the artist can see Marsh with sea birds,even 50 pairs of swans,pine trees down to the sea,the panorama of coastline and beach curving towards Milford and Lymington,the Isle of Wight on the horizon and usually a placid sea with little tidal flow. Mudeford Quay is busy with fishermen and visitors,lobster pots piled high and the ferry running to Hengistbury Head,trawlers moored to the quayside or out at sea and pleasure craft by the hundred.To the artist the scene and the cool light is a delight and the sky is incredibly blue,a feature of the area.Spectacular sunsets in the Autumn complete the picture.
